channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Review aims to change mindset and improve women's position in Singapore: Shanmugam
item.description:
September 20, 2020 12:36 PM

SINGAPORE - Through collective efforts over the years, the position of women in Singapore society has improved significantly in areas such as education, representation in Parliament and contributions to the economy, said Minister for Home Affairs and Law K. Shanmugam.

item.title: Singapore to conduct review of women's issues to bring about mindset change for gender equality
item.description:
September 20, 2020 12:36 PM

Ideas gathered though dialogues and discussions will be tabled as a White Paper in Parliament in the first half of next year.

item.title: Gender equality goes beyond performance matrices, should be instilled in children from young: Shanmugam
item.description:
September 20, 2020 12:00 PM

SINGAPORE - The idea of gender equality goes beyond matrices of performance in specific fields, and must "be imprinted deeply into our collective consciousness", said Home Affairs and Law Minister K. Shanmugam on Sunday (Sept 20).

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on Sept 20
item.description:
September 20, 2020 7:58 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Sunday, Sept 20.

item.title: Malaysian who graduated from NUS in May gets $1k a month as an intern
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Germaine Lim, 24, stays alone in a rented bedroom in Bukit Batok and earns $1,000 a month as an intern in a construction firm.

item.title: Former muay thai instructor loses appeal over sexual assault
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A former muay thai instructor, who was sentenced to seven years and four months' jail plus four strokes of the cane for sexually assaulting a woman while massaging her thigh, lost his appeal on Friday.

item.title: Hillion Mall among places infectious patients visited
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Hillion Mall in Petir Road and the Haniffa store in Little India's Dunlop Street were visited by Covid-19 patients while they were infectious, the Ministry of Health (MOH) said yesterday.

item.title: Streaming battle in South-east Asia: Blast from the past for Singapore audiences
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Popular local television serials from the 1990s, such as Under One Roof and Phua Chu Kang, have returned to TV screens.

item.title: Changes to law on cleaning standards likely in October: Grace Fu
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Changes to the law on cleaning standards are expected to be passed in Parliament next month to help the country deal with Covid-19 and other health risks, said Minister for Sustainability and the Environment Grace Fu yesterday.

item.title: Some diners in S'pore still flouting Covid-19 rules at eateries despite government clampdown
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

With the Government clamping down on food and beverage (F&B) outlets for flouting Covid-19 safe management measures last weekend, establishments in popular spots, such as Bugis, Orchard Road and Tanjong Pagar, have also come under greater scrutiny.

item.title: Robots that clean floors, chase pigeons away among technologies being tested at Tampines food centre
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Cleaning floors, monitoring pests and other laborious tasks in maintaining facilities such as food centres could soon be done by robots.

item.title: Errant restaurants in Singapore play cat-and-mouse game to flout Covid-19 safe distancing rules
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Enforcement officer John (not his real name for operational reasons) was shocked when he turned up at Hai Xian Lao restaurant in Shaw House to conduct an inspection on Aug 14.

item.title: Improve access to justice for those of lesser means after ex-maid Parti Liyani's case: Experts
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

When charged with a criminal offence or slapped with a civil lawsuit, some do not know whom to turn to, while others realise there is help only late in the process.

item.title: Lorry driver who was kept in jail for 2 extra days due to error describes time behind bars
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The man who was kept behind bars for two extra days because of a State Courts error tried to distract himself to avoid thinking about the extra hours he was spending in jail.

item.title: Hungry Ghost Festival a fruitful time for 'freegans' roaming the streets
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The belief that food offerings left out during the Hungry Ghost Festival become tasteless after spirits have "consumed" them is not true, said avid "freegan" Daniel Tay.

item.title: Sembawang God of Wealth Temple fire: Statues of deities survive, 3 dogs dead
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

A massive fire that broke out at the Sembawang God of Wealth Temple on Friday night killed three of the seven dogs that lived on the premises but left the statues of various deities intact.

item.title: Feedback 'good' as more than 500 hawkers, food delivery riders get free Covid-19 tests
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 500 stallholders, stall assistants and cleaners working at selected hawker centres and coffee shops in the Marine Parade area, along with food delivery personnel, received free Covid-19 swab tests yesterday.

item.title: Laws must reflect society's values, says Edwin Tong
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

All laws, what makes for a crime and what an appropriate sentence should be for a crime must reflect the values and the social mores of Singapore's society, said Minister for Culture, Community and Youth Edwin Tong yesterday.

item.title: Jobs hard to find for foreign graduates trying to meet S'pore bond obligation
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Some worry about having to pay back their bonds of up to $100,000 if they remain jobless after a year.

item.title: Despite language barrier and health challenges, 81-year-old woman helps neighbour in HDB flat fire
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

Despite a language barrier and health challenges, 81-year-old Lim Ee Chin came forward to help her next-door neighbour Aisyah Villegas when a fire broke out in the living room of her flat.

item.title: MOE 'actively monitoring' foreign students' bond challenges
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Education (MOE) is "actively monitoring" the situation faced by foreign students, who have difficulties securing jobs after graduating from local universities.

item.title: Shelter for female ex-offenders gets visit from President Halimah Yacob
item.description:
September 20, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob visited transitional shelter iCare Hub yesterday afternoon as part of her engagement with the community. The facility in Balestier offers a residential programme and social services support, such as counselling and therapy, for female former offenders as they rebuild their lives. More than 70 per cent of the residents are former drug abusers and the residents are aged between 20 and 65. During her visit, Madam Halimah toured the facility and met its residents and volunteers. At the event, the centre also shared how it addresses the accommodation needs of these women, as well as how it helps them find jobs and acquire the foundational skills needed to live a life free from drug addiction.Â
